sites.description: When you get to the steps of the Capitol, you find a notebook. The notebook old and as you flip through the pages, you recognize Mason's handwriting. On the inside of the back cover you find something scribbled by Mason, but it is sloppy and looks like it was written in a hurry:
sites.hint: If you're reading this, go to the church that's also a holiday

sites.description: Upon arriving in front of St. Patrick Cathedral you do not see anyone matching Mason's description. Looking around you notice a flyer on a building wall. It is a religious flying that reads "Are you lost and looking to find your way to salvation?"  It is filled with the excepted religious info about finding Jesus, but on the back of the flyer, you once again see Mason's handwriting it reads:
sites.hint: Young man, there's no need to feel down

sites.description:
The YMCA is old bridge brick building that was build in 1933. It is designed in the Italian Romanesque style and as you can see there have been additions over the years. Mason is no where to be seen.

As you look around, someone comes out of the building and approaches you. They are dress in athletic cloths, their face is flush from their work out. They smile as they come to a stop and ask "Are you looking for Mason? He said to give you this." They reach out with a note. You take it and open it and read:
sites.hint: Go to the 'Never again' monument. Make sure no one follows

sites.description:
The Holocaust Monument is a tribute to remember the structure of iron and stone. It is a reminder of one of the darkest chapters in history and a reminder to "Never Again" allow it to happen again.

At the base of the monument you see a bouquet of flowers. You pick it up and inspect the bundle. The scent fills you nose as you pull out a small card. The card reads:
sites.hint: In Midtown, find the gentleman and the Scholar

sites.description:
The marquee is above the doors is ablaze with neon blue and white light. Their is a large gathering of people in the bookstore. People are listening to a man leading a discussion, some are browsing through the stacks, and some are just there to enjoy a cup of coffee.

As you search around you notice a display of books, one of the books looks like it has a piece of paper sticking out from between it's pages. You flip the book open and take the note, it reads:
sites.hint: PA always said that those that COURT with criminal behavior are in SUPREME judgement.

sites.description:
The Supreme Court of Pennsylvania is the highest court in the Commonwealth and the oldest appellate court in the nation.

The building is white with a rounded front filled with large windows. Near the side walk, in the flower beds, you find a small wooden box. Inside you find a note that reads:
sites.hint: Go to where those that have been RECIPIENTS of the highest HONOR in the land have been MEMORIALized
